title: How You’ll Cook Salmon From Now On
sub_head: This foolproof method from chef Joe Papach yields crisp skin and meltingly tender flesh every time. Served with roasted beets, cucumbers, watercress and dill, it makes a balanced and satisfying meal.
body:
MEMORIES OF A MEAL in France plus time cooking at Gramercy Tavern in New York inspired this crisp-skinned, super-supple salmon from Joe Papach of the Harvey House in Madison, Wis. Served here with roasted beets, watercress, cucumbers and dill it’s the chef’s third Slow Food Fast recipe.
Mr. Papach sears the fish skin-side down, then lowers the temperature and bastes the flesh in olive oil and butter infused with garlic and thyme. “This approach gives a better texture,” said the chef. “The salmon is still flaky but the meat is tender, with an almost melting texture.”
